item.title: NHS sparks pride but one in five go private, survey finds
item.description: The charity Engage Britain polled more than 4,000 British adults on their attitudes to the NHS.

item.title: Covid: More than 300,000 suspected of breaking quarantine rules
item.description: It comes as the prime minister prepares to announce his winter Covid plan, including for booster jabs.

item.title: UK scraps Covid-19 vaccine deal with French firm Valneva
item.description: The French firm says the deal was cancelled over allegations of a breach of the agreement, which it denies.

item.title: England vaccine passport plans ditched, Sajid Javid says
item.description: The health secretary rules out the scheme for nightclubs and large events, following much criticism.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM set to unveil Covid Winter Plan for England
item.description: The plan will include contingency measures that would come into force if the NHS was under pressure.

item.title: GPs say shortage of doctors puts safe care at risk
item.description: The Royal College of GPs says a failure to recruit enough doctors has put services under pressure.

item.title: Covid: Vaccine protection still strong - Oxford jab creator
item.description: Prof Dame Sarah Gilbert said offering a booster dose this autumn was "a complex decision".

item.title: Long waits for ambulances continue in England
item.description: It took an average of more than eight minutes to respond to urgent call-outs, NHS figures show.

item.title: Covid: Pfizer and AstraZeneca approved as booster vaccines
item.description: The UK regulator's decision paves the way for a rollout ahead of winter to millions of people.

item.title: Why is the UK waiting when others are jabbing young teens?
item.description: Concerns over a very rare heart side-effect are giving vaccine experts pause for thought.

item.title: Covid origin: US spy agencies publish 'inconclusive' report
item.description: The office that oversees US spy agencies could not establish how the coronavirus pandemic began.

item.title: Covid: Delta variant patients twice as likely to need hospital care
item.description: Get double-jabbed to reduce this risk, advise experts who have studied different variants of the virus.

item.title: Social care charges: Disabled and vulnerable adults hit by steep rises
item.description: Many are facing a significant rise in the money they have to pay towards the support they receive.

item.title: High Street chemists to offer free blood pressure checks
item.description: The NHS initiative, for people in England over the age of 40, could save thousands of lives.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Millions of children, including 16- to 17-year-olds, are now being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-16s in the UK can get a Covid jab, as well as some vulnerable younger teens.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: How do I get the vaccine and will I need a booster?
item.description: A third dose is being offered to up to half a million people in the UK with weakened immune systems.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

item.title: How to get a Covid test
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
item.description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?
item.description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

item.title: Vaccine creator says choice of UK boosters and first doses elsewhere is 'too simplistic'
item.description: Professor Dame Sarah Gilbert says choice between offering booster jabs in the UK or first doses elsewhere is 'too simplistic'.

item.title: Boris Johnson on need to address NHS wait times
item.description: Boris Johnson says around 9m treatments could be funded by proposed government investment.

item.title: Sarah Harding death: How to do a breast cancer self-examination
item.description: Following the death of the Girls Aloud star, a GP explains the simple check people can do themselves.

item.title: NHS wait times: 'I’m not half the man I was'
item.description: Wayne Dennis, 50, has been waiting more than two years for treatment to his gallbladder.

item.title: 'My parents won't let me get the Covid vaccine'
item.description: In some countries, the Covid-19 vaccine can be given to all teenagers over the age of 12 but not all are allowed.
